		Question: what school did sir ernest rutherford go to
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is: The University of Cambridge. 

Sir Ernest Rutherford was an English chemist and physicist who made significant contributions to understanding the structure of the atom and the nucleus. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1908 for his discovery of the concept of the nucleus. He was born in 11 September 1871 and died in 16. April 1937.
